required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Dose-Response of Manipulation for Cervicogenic Headache

collaborator.agency: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine the number of visits to a chiropractor for spinal manipulation and light massage necessary for the optimal relief of cervicogenic headache (headache with associated neck pain). Effectiveness of care will also be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Headache days change from baseline for cervicogenic headache
primary_outcome.description: Days with cervicogenic headache in the last four weeks from a daily headache diary. Change score = follow-up score - baseline score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average pain change from baseline for cervicogenic headache
secondary_outcome.description: Average cervicogenic headache pain in the last four weeks evaluated by averaging daily headache diary pain scores. Pain is rated on a 0 to 11 numeric rating scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Headache-related disability change from baseline for cervicogenic headaches
Headache-related disability days change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days in the last four weeks from recall unable to carry out daily work for at least one half day because of cervicogenic headache.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average pain change from baseline for neck
secondary_outcome.description: Average neck pain in the last four weeks from recall. Pain is rated on a 0 to 11 numeric rating scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neck pain days change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days with neck pain in last 4 weeks from recall.
Number days of use of prescription and nonprescription medications for headaches with neck pain
Visits to providers outside the study for care of cervicogenic headache. Includes hospital and emergency room visits
Likert scale for success of care

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective biomechanical measures change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measures of cervical joint function and kinematics including global range of motion, spinal segmental joint restriction, pain pressure thresholds

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality-adjusted life years change from baseline
Direct & Indirect costs change from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Health services; lost work days and productivity

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived headache average pain change from baseline for cervicogenic headache
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived change in average pain from baseline on a -10 to +10 (21-point) numeric rating scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived headache improvement from baseline for cervicogenic headache
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived cervicogenic headache improvement from baseline on a 9-point Likert-like scale.

arm_group.description: 12 visits for spinal manipulation and 6 visits for light massage
6 visits for spinal manipulation and 12 visits for light massage

intervention.description: 5 minutes of high velocity, low amplitude thrust to cervical and upper thoracic spine.
5 minutes of light pressure massage to the neck and upper back

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- chronic cervicogenic headache
- threshold pain level
- threshold headache frequency
- independently ambulatory
- English literate
- candidate for spinal manipulation
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindication to thrust spinal manipulation or massage
- most other headache types
- Recent manual/exercise therapy from licensed provider for head/neck
- threshold pain medication use
- pregnancy
- involvement with another pain study
- suspicion of unmanaged depression
- most cancers
- hypertension (at least stage II)
- complicating neurological/spinal conditions
- pre-randomization noncompliance or cannot/will not comply with protocols
- health-related litigation, claims, or disability compensation

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

reference.citation: Hanson L, Haas M, Bronfort G, Vavrek D, Schulz C, Leininger B, Evans R, Takaki L, Neradilek M. Dose-response of spinal manipulation for cervicogenic headache: study protocol for a randomized controlled trial. Chiropr Man Therap. 2016 Jun 8;24:23. doi: 10.1186/s12998-016-0105-z. eCollection 2016.
